column1: #Text=ir Sun Brunniana 3/Momnsen 16/IV 46 , Mommsen an Brunn 16. April 1846 Dear Brunn , I thank You for Your letter , Surely , I never got a better !
#Text=A capitel fellow art thou - never Before I thought you half so clever , From my heart 's core I praise You , very , You and Your pocket-dietionary .
#Text=Heroically verb and noun In dread confusion do You drawn ; The particles come , tempest tost , Now downwards and now uppermost And most part by the way are lost .

#Text=Onwards You march , ne'er stopt by Blinders , The world anew at Caesar wonders , You may repeat the words too , which he To Rome wrote : Veni , vidi , vici | But never mind , You habe begin And though You have not wholly done , Yet who .
#Text=Our ears You rather now offend But do continue , that will mend .
#Text=Hoping therefore You wo n't stop there I'11l tell you shortly , how we fare .
#Text=You know my spirits were but low When I left the Campidoglio As had I too studied Your crockery - were Which to me a mockery were .
